00019 #include <stdarg.h>
00020 
00021 namespace Logging
00022 {
00024         // This enables extended argument checking by GCC.
00025         // Put this after the function or method declaration (not the definition!),
00026         // between the final closing parenthesis and the semicolon.
00027         // The first parameter indicates the 1-based index of the format string
00028         // parameter, the second parameter indicates the 1-based index of the first
00029         // variable parameter.
00030         //
00031         // Example:
00032         // void foobar(int a, const char *fmt, ...) PRINTF_PARAMS(2, 3);
00033         //
00034         // For va_list based printf style functions, specfy 0 as the second parameter.
00035         // Example:
00036         //   void foobarv(int a, const char *fmt, va_list ap) PRINTF_PARAMS(2, 0);
00037         //
00038         // Note that 'this' is counted as a method argument. For non-static methods,
00039         // add 1 to the indices.
00041         #ifdef COMPILER_GNUC
00042                 #define PRINTF_PARAMS(...) __attribute__ ((format (printf, __VA_ARGS__)))
00043                 #define SCANF_PARAMS(...) __attribute__ ((format (scanf, __VA_ARGS__)))
00044         #else
00045                 #define PRINTF_PARAMS(...)
00046                 #define SCANF_PARAMS(...)
00047         #endif
00048 
00050 
00051         // Logging level affects to log functions without *Always
00052         // Values [0..4] 4 - maximum
00053         #define LOG_LEVEL 4
00054 
00056 
00058         enum LogType
00059         {
00060                 LogT_TRACE              = 0,
00061                 LogT_INFO               = 1,
00062                 LogT_WARNING    = 2,
00063                 LogT_ERROR              = 3,
00064         };
00065 
00067 
00069 
00070         sf_interface ILogService : public module::IUnknown
00071         {
00072                 sf_uuid("aa82aafb-be77-4b20-ab68-e03b294cf7b5")
00073 
00074                 
00075                 virtual void Initialize(const char* execfile, const char* errorfile) = 0;
00076 
00078                 virtual void ClearLog() = 0;
00079 
00081                 virtual void Log(LogType type, const char* format, va_list args) PRINTF_PARAMS(3, 0) = 0;
00082 
00084                 virtual void AddListener(ILogListener *listener) = 0;
00085 
00087                 virtual void RemoveListener(ILogListener *listener) = 0;
00088         };
00089 
00091 
00092         #if LOG_LEVEL >= 4
00093                 #define LogTrace(format, ...)   Logging::_LogTraceAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00094         #endif
00095         #if LOG_LEVEL >= 3
00096                 #define LogInfo(format, ...)    Logging::_LogInfoAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00097         #endif
00098         #if LOG_LEVEL >= 2
00099                 #define LogWarning(format, ...) Logging::_LogWarningAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00100         #endif
00101         #if LOG_LEVEL >= 1
00102                 #define LogError(format, ...)   Logging::_LogErrorAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00103         #endif
00104 
00105         #define LogTraceAlways(format, ...)             Logging::_LogTraceAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00106         #define LogInfoAlways(format, ...)              Logging::_LogInfoAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00107         #define LogWarningAlways(format, ...)   Logging::_LogWarningAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00108         #define LogErrorAlways(format, ...)             Logging::_LogErrorAlways(format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00109 
00111 
00112         void _LogTraceAlways(const char *format, ...) PRINTF_PARAMS(1, 2);
00113         inline void _LogTraceAlways(const char *format, ...)
00114         {
00115                 if(Extensions::gEnv && Extensions::gEnv->Logger)
00116                 {
00117                         va_list args;
00118                         va_start(args, format);
00119                         Extensions::gEnv->Logger->Log(LogT_TRACE, format, args);
00120                         va_end(args);
00121                 }
00122         }
00123

00126         {
00127                 if(Extensions::gEnv && Extensions::gEnv->Logger)
00128                 {
00129                         va_list args;
00130                         va_start(args, format);
00131                         Extensions::gEnv->Logger->Log(LogT_INFO, format, args);

00134         }

00138         {
00139                 if(Extensions::gEnv && Extensions::gEnv->Logger)
